SUVs have gained popularity due to shifting consumer preferences towards vehicles that offer versatility, space, and a higher driving position. Many consumers perceive SUVs as more practical for various lifestyles, including families, outdoor enthusiasts, and urban commuters. The desire for vehicles capable of accommodating passengers, cargo, and diverse road conditions has driven the demand for SUVs. For Instance, in March 2024, the Peugeot E-5008 made headlines by setting a new standard as the sole all-electric SUV boasting spacious accommodation for up to 7 passengers and an impressive electric range of up to 660 km. Built upon the STLA Medium platform and equipped with a domestically manufactured battery, the E-5008 caters perfectly to the demands of customers seeking a sizable SUV with a bold design, inviting interior, and efficient electric performance. Peugeot ensures complete peace of mind for its clientele by offering the E-5008 with 8 years or 160,000 km coverage through its ALLURE CARE program. Crafted as an electric model from inception, the new E-5008 features a selection of zero-emission motors (WLTP cycles pending approval), ranging from 500 to 660 km in electric range, including an AWD Dual Motor and a Long-Range variant. With advancements in technology, SUVs have become more fuel-efficient compared to their predecessors. Automakers have introduced hybrid and electric SUV models to address environmental concerns and comply with stricter emissions regulations. For instance, in March 2024, BMW unveiled its plan to reveal the Vision Neue Klasse X SUV on March 21st, 2024. This model marks the latest addition to the company's electric SUV lineup, evident from the inclusion of the 'X' designation in its name, signifying its connection to BMW's existing X range of SUVs. The upcoming electric SUV not only represents a glimpse into BMW's forthcoming SUV offerings but also serves as a precursor to its future SUV lineup. Forming a part of BMW's Neue Klasse EV platform , this concept SUV will serve as the foundation for six new vehicles set to debut by 2025. Among these releases is a robust five-seater SUV set to follow in the footsteps of the iX3. Additionally, the perception of SUVs as safer vehicles due to their size and robust construction has contributed to their sustained popularity despite concerns about fuel consumption and emissions. However, despite advancements in fuel efficiency and the emergence of electric SUVs, environmental concerns regarding greenhouse gas emissions and fuel consumption remain significant. Stricter emissions regulations imposed by governments worldwide may limit the appeal of traditional gas-powered SUVs, leading to increased scrutiny and potential restrictions on their sales and usage. SUV Market Trends Expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings could emerge as a key factor strengthening the SUV industry. Hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as a transitional solution for consumers who want improved fuel efficiency without fully committing to electric vehicles. MARKET DYNAMICS: Manufacturers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs, enhancing safety, connectivity, and performance. Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Price and Variants : The XUV 3XO comes in both petrol and diesel versions, starting at an ex-showroom price of 7.49 lakh, with the top model priced at 15.49 lakh. The electric version, named the XUV400, also starts at 15.49 lakh. Design and Assembly : The vehicle boasts the Heartcore design philosophy and has been designed by Pratap Bose. Its built on the KG Mobility Tivoli platform and assembled in Nashik, India. This design collaboration between Mahindras India design studio in Mumbai and the Mahindra Research Valley in Chennai results in a robust yet elegant SUV. Dimensions and Exterior Features : Exterior highlights include LED fog lamps, a piano black grille, Bi-LED projector headlamps with LED DRLs, and Infinity LED tail lamps. The Mahindra XUV 3XO impresses with its compact yet robust dimensions, spanning 4 meters in length, 1.8 meters in width, and 1.6 meters in height, combined with a 5.3 meter turning radius and a ground clearance of 201 mm. It can wade through water up to 350 mm deep, showcasing its capability for mild off-roading adventures. review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Mahindra XUV 3XO review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Out goes the Mahindra XUV300 and in comes the XUV 3XO. The new name is just the starting point of a very comprehensive upgrade. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,095 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Mileage, Specifications, Features and Variants Brand Mahindra Model Name XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Price 9.06 - 18.39 lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO Range/Mileage Petrol : 17.96 - 20.1kpl | Diesel : 20.6 - 21.2kpl Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications SUV | 5 doors | 5 seats View All Specs Mahindra XUV 3XO Features LED headlight | 10.25-inch Touchscreen display | 6 airbags View All Features Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants MX1 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M (O) 1.2 Petrol MT View All Variants In its basic shape though, the 3XO is no different than the XUV300. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. {'url': 'https://www.bajajfinserv.in/mahindra-xuv-3xo-safety-rating', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings NCAP, safety features, and more | Bajaj Finance Home Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings BOOK NOW Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings BOOK NOW 3 min 23 November 2024 The Indian automobile market is currently witnessing a rapid transformation, driven by changing consumer preferences and an increasing focus on safety. When considering the purchase of a vehicle, safety should always be a top priority for buyers. Safety ratings provide essential insights into how effectively a car can protect its occupants during collisions. In an era where road safety is a growing concern, informed consumers depend on these ratings to ensure that their chosen vehicle offers the highest level of protection. The Mahindra XUV 3XO exemplifies this commitment to safety and performance, showcasing Mahindra's dedication to quality, durability, and innovation. Beyond evaluating safety features, making sound financial decisions is crucial when purchasing a vehicle. This is where car loans become invaluable tools. Financing options, such as the new car loan from Bajaj Finance, provide the flexibility needed to make car ownership more manageable. Bajaj Finance simplifies your borrowing experience by offering high-value new car loans with straightforward eligibility criteria and minimal documentation. This article will explore the safety ratings of the Mahindra XUV 3XO and its impressive safety features. We will also examine how a Bajaj Finserv New Car Loan can assist you in funding your vehicle purchase. What are safety ratings and who provides them? Safety ratings are critical indicators of how well a vehicle can protect its occupants during a crash. These ratings are given after comprehensive testing by independent organisations that assess various aspects of vehicle safety. These include structural integrity, airbag effectiveness, and safety assist technologies. The aim is to help potential buyers make an informed decision about a cars ability to safeguard its passengers. Here are the main organisations that provide safety ratings: Global NCAP : This globally respected body conducts crash tests and rates vehicles on a scale from one to five stars based on their performance in various crash scenarios. Euro NCAP : Known for its detailed evaluations, this organisation focuses on adult and child protection, pedestrian safety, and safety assist technologies. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12985 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making a significant impact in the competitive SUV market. This report provides a detailed analysis of the SUV market trends, the XUV 3XO's unique features, its luxury and safety aspects, and its sales performance. The SUV market is experiencing substantial growth, driven by changing consumer preferences and increasing demand for versatile vehicles. Mahindra's XUV 3XO aims to capture a significant share of this market with its blend of modern design, advanced technology, and competitive pricing.

This section provides a high-level overview of the key findings and strategic implications.

  • SUV market is growing at a CAGR of 6% and is expected to reach $2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a blend of modern design and advanced technology.
  • XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Sales data indicates a promising start, with potential for further growth.

Market Analysis.

The SUV market is experiencing robust growth, driven by factors such as increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and a growing preference for versatile vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Electric and hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs to enhance safety, connectivity, and performance. The global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period, reaching a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032. Key trends include the expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings, increasing demand in emerging markets, and innovations in autonomous driving features.

This section analyzes the industry landscape and trends in the SUV market.

  • Global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected CAGR of 6% to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUV options.
  • Advanced technology integration enhances safety, connectivity, and performance.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of performance, comfort, and technology. It comes with multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel engine. The XUV 3XO offers a spacious interior, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a panoramic sunroof. Key features include Level 2 ADAS, multiple airbags, and connected car technology. The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a wheelbase of 2600 mm. Its design includes LED DRLs, infinity tail lamps, and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels.

This section provides detailed information on the features, specifications, and technology of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Engine options: 1.2L turbo petrol and 1.5L diesel.
  • Spacious interior with a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
  • Panoramic sunroof and Level 2 ADAS.
  • Dimensions: Length 3990 mm, Width 1821 mm, Wheelbase 2600 mm.

Luxury Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers several luxury features designed to enhance comfort and sophistication. These include premium leatherette seats, a soft-touch dashboard, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The interior design focuses on creating a modern and luxurious ambiance. The XUV 3XO also features a cooled glovebox with illumination and passive keyless entry. The seats are designed to offer maximum comfort during long drives, and the interior materials are chosen for their premium feel and durability.

This section highlights the luxury and comfort features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch dashboard.
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination.
  • Passive keyless entry.

Safety Features.

Safety is a key priority for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, which has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It includes active and passive safety systems, such as multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control, lane-keep assist, and auto emergency braking. The robust build quality and advanced driver assistance systems ensure passenger protection in various driving conditions. The vehicle is equipped with ISOFIX child seat anchorages for secure child seating.

This section details the safety features and crash test ratings of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control.
  • Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist.
  • ISOFIX child seat anchorages.

Sales Trend.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has shown promising sales trends since its launch. The sales figures indicate a strong market reception, with consistent monthly sales and a growing customer base. The XUV 3XO has achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. However, recent data indicates a slight MoM decline in sales. The strong sales performance can be attributed to its competitive pricing, advanced features, and positive reviews.

Mahindra
XUV 3XO

Executive Summary Market Analysis Features Luxury Safety Sales Trend
☰ Mahindra XUV 3XO

Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making a significant impact in the competitive SUV market. This report provides a detailed analysis of the SUV market trends, the XUV 3XO's unique features, its luxury and safety aspects, and its sales performance. The SUV market is experiencing substantial growth, driven by changing consumer preferences and increasing demand for versatile vehicles. Mahindra's XUV 3XO aims to capture a significant share of this market with its blend of modern design, advanced technology, and competitive pricing.

This section provides a high-level overview of the key findings and strategic implications.

  • SUV market is growing at a CAGR of 6% and is expected to reach $2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a blend of modern design and advanced technology.
  • XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Sales data indicates a promising start, with potential for further growth.

Market Analysis.

The SUV market is experiencing robust growth, driven by factors such as increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and a growing preference for versatile vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Electric and hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs to enhance safety, connectivity, and performance. The global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period, reaching a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032. Key trends include the expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings, increasing demand in emerging markets, and innovations in autonomous driving features.

This section analyzes the industry landscape and trends in the SUV market.

  • Global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected CAGR of 6% to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUV options.
  • Advanced technology integration enhances safety, connectivity, and performance.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of performance, comfort, and technology. It comes with multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel engine. The XUV 3XO offers a spacious interior, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a panoramic sunroof. Key features include Level 2 ADAS, multiple airbags, and connected car technology. The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a wheelbase of 2600 mm. Its design includes LED DRLs, infinity tail lamps, and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels.

This section provides detailed information on the features, specifications, and technology of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Engine options: 1.2L turbo petrol and 1.5L diesel.
  • Spacious interior with a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
  • Panoramic sunroof and Level 2 ADAS.
  • Dimensions: Length 3990 mm, Width 1821 mm, Wheelbase 2600 mm.

Luxury Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers several luxury features designed to enhance comfort and sophistication. These include premium leatherette seats, a soft-touch dashboard, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The interior design focuses on creating a modern and luxurious ambiance. The XUV 3XO also features a cooled glovebox with illumination and passive keyless entry. The seats are designed to offer maximum comfort during long drives, and the interior materials are chosen for their premium feel and durability.

This section highlights the luxury and comfort features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch dashboard.
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination.
  • Passive keyless entry.

Safety Features.

Safety is a key priority for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, which has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It includes active and passive safety systems, such as multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control, lane-keep assist, and auto emergency braking. The robust build quality and advanced driver assistance systems ensure passenger protection in various driving conditions. The vehicle is equipped with ISOFIX child seat anchorages for secure child seating.

This section details the safety features and crash test ratings of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control.
  • Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist.
  • ISOFIX child seat anchorages.

Sales Trend.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has shown promising sales trends since its launch. The sales figures indicate a strong market reception, with consistent monthly sales and a growing customer base. The XUV 3XO has achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. However, recent data indicates a slight MoM decline in sales. The strong sales performance can be attributed to its competitive pricing, advanced features, and positive reviews.

The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Mahindra XUV 3XO review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Out goes the Mahindra XUV300 and in comes the XUV 3XO. The new name is just the starting point of a very comprehensive upgrade. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,095 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. It can wade through water up to 350 mm deep, showcasing its capability for mild off-roading adventures. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Mileage, Specifications, Features and Variants Brand Mahindra Model Name XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Price 9.06 - 18.39 lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO Range/Mileage Petrol : 17.96 - 20.1kpl | Diesel : 20.6 - 21.2kpl Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications SUV | 5 doors | 5 seats View All Specs Mahindra XUV 3XO Features LED headlight | 10.25-inch Touchscreen display | 6 airbags View All Features Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants MX1 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M (O) 1.2 Petrol MT View All Variants In its basic shape though, the 3XO is no different than the XUV300. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. nodes.agent_prompt: Investigate the safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering active and passive safety systems, crash test ratings, and driver-assistance technologies. Include details on how these features compare to industry standards and competing vehicles.

output.initial_thoughts: Let me think through this. The user wants me to investigate the safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including active and passive safety systems, crash test ratings, and driver-assistance technologies. I need to compare these features to industry standards and competing vehicles. I'll start by searching the web for this information using `search_web_with_text_content`.

code.CODE_1:

output = {'safety_features': results}
code.CODE_2:
results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features review ratings comparison', 6)
output = {'safety_features': results}
code.CODE_3:

{'url': 'https://www.bajajfinserv.in/mahindra-xuv-3xo-safety-rating', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings NCAP, safety features, and more | Bajaj Finance Home Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings Read our handy guide to know the safety ratings of this car and how a Bajaj Finserv New Car Loan can help in funding your car purchase. BOOK NOW Mahindra XUV 3XO safety ratings BOOK NOW 3 min 23 November 2024 The Indian automobile market is currently witnessing a rapid transformation, driven by changing consumer preferences and an increasing focus on safety. When considering the purchase of a vehicle, safety should always be a top priority for buyers. Safety ratings provide essential insights into how effectively a car can protect its occupants during collisions. In an era where road safety is a growing concern, informed consumers depend on these ratings to ensure that their chosen vehicle offers the highest level of protection. The Mahindra XUV 3XO exemplifies this commitment to safety and performance, showcasing Mahindra's dedication to quality, durability, and innovation. Beyond evaluating safety features, making sound financial decisions is crucial when purchasing a vehicle. This is where car loans become invaluable tools. Financing options, such as the new car loan from Bajaj Finance, provide the flexibility needed to make car ownership more manageable. Bajaj Finance simplifies your borrowing experience by offering high-value new car loans with straightforward eligibility criteria and minimal documentation. This article will explore the safety ratings of the Mahindra XUV 3XO and its impressive safety features. We will also examine how a Bajaj Finserv New Car Loan can assist you in funding your vehicle purchase. What are safety ratings and who provides them? Safety ratings are critical indicators of how well a vehicle can protect its occupants during a crash. These ratings are given after comprehensive testing by independent organisations that assess various aspects of vehicle safety. These include structural integrity, airbag effectiveness, and safety assist technologies. The aim is to help potential buyers make an informed decision about a cars ability to safeguard its passengers. Here are the main organisations that provide safety ratings: Global NCAP : This globally respected body conducts crash tests and rates vehicles on a scale from one to five stars based on their performance in various crash scenarios. Euro NCAP : Known for its detailed evaluations, this organisation focuses on adult and child protection, pedestrian safety, and safety assist technologies. Bharat NCAP : Indias official safety programme , which ensures that vehicles sold in the country meet national safety standards. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12985 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Gunning For The 2nd Spot While their usual sales heroes like the Scorpio and XUV700 have been performing well for several years now, the 3XO along with some help from Thar Roxx, Mahindra are shaking up the auto industry. And this behaviour isnt going to change. With the BE6 and XEV 9e, they have conveyed that theyre not just here to sell electric cars. Theyre here to set new benchmarks in terms of value and features. The pricing of these 2 EVs has shaken up not just carmakers like Hyundai, Tata and Maruti but also the Chinese/Chinese-owned carmakers like MG and BYD are feeling the sting. So much so that MG jacked up the prices of the ZS while leaving the base price unchanged. On top of that, they are willing to give away discounts of up to ~Rs. 2.50 lakh on the base trim, which is the highest we have ever seen. So, the price hike was just a smoke screen when in reality, they are feeling the pinch from Mahindras BE6 and the Tata Curvv EV. We were counting on having a price war in the EV space in the 2025 - 28 period but a non-Chinese carmaker would take the first swing that, we didnt expect. The first swing will come from an Indian carmaker, that didnt just come as a surprise, it came as a shock. Its not this move that should scare the Chinese and even other carmakers. Its their attitude and hunger for greater market share, which should scare their rivals. The EV strategy suggests that this time around, they arent just going for one more bite out of the pie. They want the whole pie to themselves. Of course, it's not going to be easy but it looks like they are gunning for it anyway. That should make Hyundai very worried as they have maintained their hold on the 2nd spot in the Indian car market for God knows how long. In average sales, though, Hyundai remain firmly in the 2nd spot while Tata in 3rd spot. Mahindra are in the 4th spot with an average shortage of 1459 every month. Gunning For The 2nd Spot While their usual sales heroes like the Scorpio and XUV700 have been performing well for several years now, the 3XO along with some help from Thar Roxx, Mahindra are shaking up the auto industry. Close Menu

Mahindra
XUV 3XO

Executive Summary Market Analysis Features Luxury Safety Sales Trend
☰ Mahindra XUV 3XO

Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making a significant impact in the competitive SUV market. This report provides a detailed analysis of the SUV market trends, the XUV 3XO's unique features, its luxury and safety aspects, and its sales performance. The SUV market is experiencing substantial growth, driven by changing consumer preferences and increasing demand for versatile vehicles. Mahindra's XUV 3XO aims to capture a significant share of this market with its blend of modern design, advanced technology, and competitive pricing.

This section provides a high-level overview of the key findings and strategic implications.

  • SUV market is growing at a CAGR of 6% and is expected to reach $2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a blend of modern design and advanced technology.
  • XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Sales data indicates a promising start, with potential for further growth.

Market Analysis.

The SUV market is experiencing robust growth, driven by factors such as increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and a growing preference for versatile vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Electric and hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs to enhance safety, connectivity, and performance. The global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period, reaching a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032. Key trends include the expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings, increasing demand in emerging markets, and innovations in autonomous driving features.

This section analyzes the industry landscape and trends in the SUV market.

  • Global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected CAGR of 6% to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUV options.
  • Advanced technology integration enhances safety, connectivity, and performance.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of performance, comfort, and technology. It comes with multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel engine. The XUV 3XO offers a spacious interior, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a panoramic sunroof. Key features include Level 2 ADAS, multiple airbags, and connected car technology. The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a wheelbase of 2600 mm. Its design includes LED DRLs, infinity tail lamps, and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels.

This section provides detailed information on the features, specifications, and technology of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Engine options: 1.2L turbo petrol and 1.5L diesel.
  • Spacious interior with a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
  • Panoramic sunroof and Level 2 ADAS.
  • Dimensions: Length 3990 mm, Width 1821 mm, Wheelbase 2600 mm.

Luxury Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers several luxury features designed to enhance comfort and sophistication. These include premium leatherette seats, a soft-touch dashboard, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The interior design focuses on creating a modern and luxurious ambiance. The XUV 3XO also features a cooled glovebox with illumination and passive keyless entry. The seats are designed to offer maximum comfort during long drives, and the interior materials are chosen for their premium feel and durability.

This section highlights the luxury and comfort features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch dashboard.
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination.
  • Passive keyless entry.

Safety Features.

Safety is a key priority for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, which has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It includes active and passive safety systems, such as multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control, lane-keep assist, and auto emergency braking. The robust build quality and advanced driver assistance systems ensure passenger protection in various driving conditions. The vehicle is equipped with ISOFIX child seat anchorages for secure child seating.

This section details the safety features and crash test ratings of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control.
  • Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist.
  • ISOFIX child seat anchorages.

Sales Trend.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has shown promising sales trends since its launch. The sales figures indicate a strong market reception, with consistent monthly sales and a growing customer base. The XUV 3XO has achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. However, recent data indicates a slight MoM decline in sales. The strong sales performance can be attributed to its competitive pricing, advanced features, and positive reviews.

This section provides analysis of the sales trend of Mahindra XUV 3XO and its sales performance

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO showing promising sales trends since launch
  • Sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months
  • Slight MoM decline in recent sales figures
  • Strong sales performance can be attributed to competitive pricing and advanced features

report_sections.content: The SUV market is experiencing robust growth, driven by factors such as increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and a growing preference for versatile vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Electric and hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs to enhance safety, connectivity, and performance. The global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period, reaching a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032. Key trends include the expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings, increasing demand in emerging markets, and innovations in autonomous driving features.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section analyzes the industry landscape and trends in the SUV market.
bullet_points: Global SUV market size was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
Projected CAGR of 6% to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
Increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUV options.
Advanced technology integration enhances safety, connectivity, and performance.

report_sections.heading: Mahindra XUV 3XO Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of performance, comfort, and technology. It comes with multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel engine. The XUV 3XO offers a spacious interior, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a panoramic sunroof. Key features include Level 2 ADAS, multiple airbags, and connected car technology. The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a wheelbase of 2600 mm. Its design includes LED DRLs, infinity tail lamps, and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides detailed information on the features, specifications, and technology of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.
bullet_points: Engine options: 1.2L turbo petrol and 1.5L diesel.
Spacious interior with a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
Panoramic sunroof and Level 2 ADAS.
Dimensions: Length 3990 mm, Width 1821 mm, Wheelbase 2600 mm.

report_sections.heading: Luxury Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers several luxury features designed to enhance comfort and sophistication. These include premium leatherette seats, a soft-touch dashboard, and a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The interior design focuses on creating a modern and luxurious ambiance. The XUV 3XO also features a cooled glovebox with illumination and passive keyless entry. The seats are designed to offer maximum comfort during long drives, and the interior materials are chosen for their premium feel and durability.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section highlights the luxury and comfort features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.
bullet_points: Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch dashboard.
Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
Cooled glovebox with illumination.
Passive keyless entry.

report_sections.heading: Safety Features
report_sections.content: Safety is a key priority for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, which has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. It includes active and passive safety systems, such as multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control. The XUV 3XO also features Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control, lane-keep assist, and auto emergency braking. The robust build quality and advanced driver assistance systems ensure passenger protection in various driving conditions. The vehicle is equipped with ISOFIX child seat anchorages for secure child seating.

bullet_points: 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests.
Multiple airbags, ABS with EBD, and electronic stability control.
Level 2 ADAS with adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist.
ISOFIX child seat anchorages.

report_sections.heading: Sales Trend
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has shown promising sales trends since its launch. The sales figures indicate a strong market reception, with consistent monthly sales and a growing customer base. The XUV 3XO has achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. However, recent data indicates a slight MoM decline in sales. The strong sales performance can be attributed to its competitive pricing, advanced features, and positive reviews.
